Description: Rectangular fragment of a writing-board, made of wood, covered with gesso and painted white.
Curator's comments: Black and white photos show an old label with the number '5647b' There is also an Italian inscription on the back in the corner: alli Sig' Viaggi (g)ottio di (odi). This was mis-cited as an 'ostracon' from the British Museum, mentioning PA-kfjw 'the Cretan' by W. Max Mueller in OLZ 2 (1899), 38, where he gave three numbers: '5630, no. 29558, gelb 5647b'. Vercoutter, L'Egypte et le monde prehellenique, followed by Helck, Beziehungen zur Ägäis and Haider, Griechenland - Nordafrika, miscites the number as '5647'.
Bibliographic references: Dautais et al. 2022 / La tablette comptable British Museum EA 29558 (158-181)
